reviews.review:
(Revisão em 2020: Essa análise é muito curta e fala muito mal da mecânica principal do jogo. Ainda recomendo imensamente, apesar disso.)

Do singelo começo até o espetacular final, é difícil encontrar algo para não gostar em Portal, um curto FPS experimental com uma reviravolta no genêro.

Portal usa um conceito que vai se desenvolvendo ao longo do jogo: Portais (duh); Como eles seguem um certo conjunto de regras, você vai ter que aprender a “pensar com portais”. Vai te fazer pensar onde colocar os portais, o local exato onde precisa ir, e o timing de quando precisam ser trocados. É realmente algo bem divertido de se brincar, afinal, nenhum outro jogo te permite fazer uma queda infinita.
Portal seria apenas um jogo de puzzle legal, mas sem nenhuma essência real, se não fosse por GLaDOS; A voz sarcástica e fria que monitora todo os testes é com certeza o que faz do jogo um dos melhores exemplos de escrita em videogames. Sério, até mesmo as torretas tem personalidade, que quando derrubadas dizem coisas do tipo “Eu não te odeio” e “Porquê!?”. Existe também essa pequena sensação que fora das câmaras de testes, algo está acontecendo...
O que pode ser considerado o único defeito desse jogo é como o jogo é curto. Eu creio ter finalizado em 4-5 horas, e existem jogadores que constaram menos que isso. Como o jogo foi feito por uma pequena equipe, infelizmente não conseguiram mais do que isso em pouco tempo. 

Um curto porém interessante jogo, Portal é um curto jogo com gameplay e escrita ótimas. Se você é um dos seletos que ainda não o jogou, compre-o agora; Existe um motivo de porquê esse jogo está na biblioteca de quase todo usuário na Steam.

Even though the game is short, the story is just amazing and well constructed! Also the game lends itself quite good for speedrunning as it can be played quite fast paced so that you can still replay it over and over just to get fast!

Holds up against Old Father Time and easily earns its spot as an all-timer. 

It sure is shorter than I remember but man is Portal still fun. I think the portal mechanic is well known at this point but its (as always) Valve's level design approach that really cemented this game's fun. Its all laid out logically and in a fun way with each level/test being a unique experience. If anything, the end boss battle has certainly lost its tenseness but the regular levels are pure level design classics. 

Only a select few PC games reach the "must play" category. And many of those can be agrued slightly. Portal is one of the select few of the select few that just simply must be at least attempted.

Portal is the brainchild of a project by graduating university students, an impressive feat in its own right. But does it truly hold up to all the praise it has received over the years? In short: yes, it does so very well. What, you wanted the long version? Okay then.....

First of all, let's talk about the gameplay. The game's physics work very well and tie well into its major selling point, the Apperture Science Handheld Portal Device. The dual portal limitation may seem unfair, but it allows for clever multi-step puzzles that require plenty of thought. One rather ingenious example is[spoiler]the GLaDOS fight, which is essentially by design a huge multi-step puzzle with a time limit instead to add extra pressure.[/spoiler]

Sound wise, the game's soundtrack is perfectly fitting for a seemingly bleak laboratory in the middle of who-knows-where. The instrumentation is well selected and everything sounds right. Yes, this even goes for the turrets and their adorable little voices.

My one minor gripe is the lack of post-game content. Sure, you can replay the main story to get the achievements you missed or take on bonus challenges, but there really isn't much left to do after watching the credits roll to Still Alive.

Overall, Portal is a great game worth checking out and a fun way to strain your brain for a couple hours as you figure everything out.

Verdict: "Worth your time!"
Final remarks: Cake's still a lie.

Mega fajna gra. Szkoda, że jeśli zna się ją na pamięć (tak jak ja) to staje się krótka. Plusem jest bardzo długi Level 19. Fajne są dodatkowe poziomy, a walka z bossem jest niesamowita. Trzeba trochę przy niej pomyśleć. Grafika jest naprawdę ładna. Jak dotąd nie spotkałem żadnego błędu w tej grze.

Plusy:
- grafika 10/10
- ciekawy pomysł na grę
- bardzo dokładnie wykonane portale
- bardzo długi 19 Level
- mega Bbss
- brak błędów

Minusy:
- nie dopracowana Chell
- nie dopracowane tekstury pod tą zieloną wodą lub mazią (nie wiem co to jest)

Moja ocena: 9/10

The cake is a lie

8/10. The lesser younger brother of its refined, pure, perfect successor. An incredible proof of concept. Perhaps that it is too dismissive, because it is only underwhelming in comparison to Portal 2.

Okay. I've been putting off doing this for a while, but I need to now. Portal was the (probaly) the first game I ever bought on Steam. I saw it in the background of some video, and I was instantly fascinated by the sheer gameplay. I had to buy this game. So I did, and unlike usual, I did not regret it. I picked it up, and ten hours later, I put it down again. Marvelous. From the moment you start out playing, you are a test subject named Chell, who is accompanied through the levels by the disembodied voice of an incredibly nefarious AI named GLaDOS. GLaDOS is easily my favorite character from any video game I've played since, just from sheer hillariousness, bitterness, and personality.
If you want an intriguing puzzle game with some hillarious dialouge from a hillariously mean AI, 
If you want the simply greatest lore from any video game ever
If you want the greatest game on steam
Get Portal. 

PS. [spoiler] the cake is a lie[/spoiler]
Worth it.
